title.narrative: Mechanism 17345 - Alliance MAT

description.narrative: (1) The goal of the TBD mechanism is to provide targeted technical assistance to MAT programs in Ukraine. Currently MAT is supported solely by GFATM, and possibility of uninterrupted continuation by GoU after the end of GF grant is questionable. Establishment of new financial models of MAT provision is a key to program sustainability. Such activities are proposed but not budgeted in the draft National AIDS Program 2014-2018. Project objectives are: (a) Systematize and scale up alternative forms of MAT organization, including but not limited to: fully/partially covered by patient fees, NGO-based, private clinic based, pharmacy based paid or non-paid, prescription provision. (b) Improve quality of MAT in existing programs; (c) Facilitate scale-up of integrated treatment approaches; (d) Collect evidence about outcomes of MAT after patient discharge and provide guidance on post-discharge patient management. (2) The project will work on both national and local levels and will primarily target health care providers with direct benefit to PWID and existing clients of MAT programs. (3) the project is aimed at developing and piloting of new self-sustained models, which will result in cost-saving for the National program. (4) New models of MAT provision will be less costly which will increase the chance of continued GoU support for MAT. Opportunities to provide MAT in private settings will also be explored. First objective of the project corresponds to one of the draft NAP unfunded objectives; this makes a good case for early adoption of new models by GoU. (5) The project will report on a custom capacity building indicator that will measure USG TA contributions to the PF goals. Number of supported sites will be monitored through Partner Site Inventory.
